trans-unit.source: Returns an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: Returns an array with the following format:

target.mrk: Returns an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: [0] - Comma separated string displaying TTF_ flags used

seg-source.mrk: [0] - Comma separated string displaying TTF_ flags used

target.mrk: [0] - Comma separated string displaying TTF_ flags used

trans-unit.source: TTF_IDISHWND = Indicates that $iID is the window handle to the tool instead of the ID

seg-source.mrk: TTF_IDISHWND = Indicates that $iID is the window handle to the tool instead of the ID

target.mrk: TTF_IDISHWND = Indicates that $iID is the window handle to the tool instead of the ID

trans-unit.source: TTF_CENTERTIP = Centers the window below the tool specified by $iID

seg-source.mrk: TTF_CENTERTIP = Centers the window below the tool specified by $iID

target.mrk: TTF_CENTERTIP = Centers the window below the tool specified by $iID

trans-unit.source: TTF_RTLREADING = Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction

seg-source.mrk: TTF_RTLREADING = Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction

target.mrk: TTF_RTLREADING = Indicates that text will be displayed in the opposite direction

trans-unit.source: TTF_SUBCLASS = Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window to intercept messages

seg-source.mrk: TTF_SUBCLASS = Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window to intercept messages

target.mrk: TTF_SUBCLASS = Indicates that the control should subclass the tool's window to intercept messages

trans-unit.source: TTF_TRACK = Positions the control next to the tool to which it corresponds

seg-source.mrk: TTF_TRACK = Positions the control next to the tool to which it corresponds

target.mrk: TTF_TRACK = Positions the control next to the tool to which it corresponds

trans-unit.source: TTF_ABSOLUTE = Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION

seg-source.mrk: TTF_ABSOLUTE = Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION

target.mrk: TTF_ABSOLUTE = Positions the window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION

trans-unit.source: TTF_TRANSPARENT = Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

seg-source.mrk: TTF_TRANSPARENT = Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

target.mrk: TTF_TRANSPARENT = Causes the control to forward mouse messages to the parent window

trans-unit.source: TTF_PARSELINKS = Indicates that links in the control text should be parsed

seg-source.mrk: TTF_PARSELINKS = Indicates that links in the control text should be parsed

target.mrk: TTF_PARSELINKS = Indicates that links in the control text should be parsed

trans-unit.source: [1] - Handle to the window that contains the tool

seg-source.mrk: [1] - Handle to the window that contains the tool

target.mrk: [1] - Handle to the window that contains the tool

trans-unit.source: [2] - Identifier of the tool

seg-source.mrk: [2] - Identifier of the tool

target.mrk: [2] - Identifier of the tool

trans-unit.source: [3] - X coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [3] - X coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [3] - X coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [4] - Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [4] - Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [4] - Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [5] - X coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [5] - X coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [5] - X coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [6] - Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

seg-source.mrk: [6] - Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

target.mrk: [6] - Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle

trans-unit.source: [7] - Handle to the instance that contains the string resource for the tool

seg-source.mrk: [7] - Handle to the instance that contains the string resource for the tool

target.mrk: [7] - Handle to the instance that contains the string resource for the tool

trans-unit.source: [8] - Text for the tool

seg-source.mrk: [8] - Text for the tool

target.mrk: [8] - Text for the tool

trans-unit.source: [9] - Application-defined value associated with the tool

seg-source.mrk: [9] - Application-defined value associated with the tool

target.mrk: [9] - Application-defined value associated with the tool

trans-unit.source: $iError is the return code you want the function to return to the calling process.

seg-source.mrk: $iError is the return code you want the function to return to the calling process.

target.mrk: $iError is the return code you want the function to return to the calling process.

trans-unit.source: This function is usually used with other UDF functions to disassemble the $tagTOOLINFO structure to an array for display purposes.

target.mrk: This function is usually used with other UDF functions to disassemble the $tagTOOLINFO structure to an array for display purposes.
